Accoustic Guitar.Description:
The acoustic guitar, stemming from ancient predecessors like the lute and oud, has evolved into a versatile instrument beloved for its rich tonal qualities.

With steel-string guitars offering bright tones for folk, country, rock, and pop, and classical guitars providing warm sounds for classical and flamenco, the acoustic guitar caters to a wide array of musical styles.

As an iconic instrument capable of evoking emotions across genres, the acoustic guitar remains cherished by musicians worldwide.

Body.name: Body
Body.description:
Material: Mahogany
Type: Hollow
Style: Grand Auditorium

The acoustic guitar body is typically crafted from wood. Hollow guitars produce tones of great depth.

Bridge.name: Bridge
Bridge.description:
Material: Mahogany

Serves as the anchor point for the strings, transmitting their vibrations to the instrument's body to produce its distinctive tone.

BridgePins.name: Bridge Pins
BridgePins.description:
Size: 0.210"
Fit: Larrive D-03R

Bridge pins, typically made of materials like plastic, bone, or ebony, secure the strings to the bridge of an acoustic guitar.

NeckHead.name: Neck
NeckHead.description:
Profile: Rounded
Fret Count: 19
Fingerboard Material: Rosewood
Radius: 304.8 mm / 12 in

Serves as the guitar's central support structure, housing the fretboard and strings, and significantly influencing the instrument's playability, comfort, and overall tone.

Strings.name: Strings
Strings.description:
Material: Nylon
Count: 6

Commonly used on classical guitars, nylon strings produce a warm and mellow tone with a smooth feel under the fingers.


Gauges:
.012, .016, .024, .032, .042, .053

TuningPegs.name: Tuning Machines
TuningPegs.description:
Format: Clover

Essential components located on the headstock of an acoustic guitar, facilitating precise adjustment of string tension to achieve accurate pitch.

Gibson ES-335.Description:
The Gibson ES-335 is an iconic semi-hollowbody electric guitar celebrated for its innovative design and versatile sound. Introduced in 1958, it features a distinctive double-cutaway body with a center block running through the body to reduce feedback while retaining the rich resonance of a hollowbody instrument.

The ES-335's combination of solid construction and hollow wings produces a unique tone prized by musicians across various genres, including jazz, blues, rock, and beyond.

Renowned players such as BB King, Chuck Berry, and Eric Clapton have all wielded the ES-335, showcasing its adaptability and enduring appeal in the realm of electric guitars.

Body.description:
Design: Semi-Hollow
Material: Maple
Finish: 
Gloss Nitrocellulose Lacquer

A semi-hollow design crafted with a laminated maple top, back, and sides, providing a warm, resonant tone with reduced susceptibility to feedback.

Gibson SG Standard.Description:
The Gibson SG, an abbreviation for "Solid Guitar," is a revered electric guitar celebrated for its iconic double-cutaway design, facilitating effortless access to higher frets and ensuring a comfortable playing experience.

Originally introduced in 1961 as a reimagining of the Les Paul model, the SG swiftly garnered favor among guitarists for its lightweight yet resonant mahogany body, delivering a commanding and adaptable tone suited for an array of musical genres.

With its sleek aesthetics and aggressive sound, the SG has become a staple in rock and blues, notably championed by luminaries such as Angus Young of AC/DC and Tony Iommi of Black Sabbath, while also finding resonance in other genres such as jazz and alternative rock. Its enduring legacy cements the Gibson SG as an emblematic instrument in the pantheon of electric guitars.
